documents.document: "Gosh this is fascinating, isn't it?" The @CheckpointRNZ #JohnCampbell euphemism for "does anyone know WTF is going on?"
Hashtags I think I was surely 1st to use - but no. #love_Hz It's a radio station. Why should that surprise me?
...and it's got a thin skin.
Did that. Know now :)
I think there's a growing assumption that if people don't recognise an obscure abbreviation they can always Google it, so u don't explain.
https://t.co/qcrQzKHHJY Interesting piece, but meaning of GOAT not clear to me. Wd associate "goat illusion" with stage magic, not tennis.
I was late to the thought: five already :) https://t.co/LeYiUAOevo

Pheasants protest & refuse to take to the air. Birds & shooters have a dialogue centred on the word/sound "Look!"
@NZMorningReport And the place where Islam was founded #Mecca #Medina
@NZMorningReport Not just "why be concerned about someone from Iran?" But why NOT someone from Saudi Arabia, home to most 9/11 hijackers?

.@SparkNZ down this week; @vodafoneNZ next week? It happens surprisingly often. Maybe installing/updating the same piece of faulty software?
Why do some singers feel they have to hold onto the mike, even though it's on a substantial mount? #StevieNicks #SkyArts
Ok, some of what they did was humiliating, but the veg bit is just strange. Fair bet everyone concerned was very drunk. @NZStuff
Today's most popular @NZStuff story. "Girl gang humiliate footballer" - by "slicing vegetables over him" #dontgetit

It's a misnomer to call this an interview; it's a lecture by the interviewer on what she thinks @ninetonoon #stateownedmedia
Just reluctantly switched off the crime & punishment expert on @ninetonoon because he's barely being allowed to get a word in...
Perhaps "conversion [to one's own use]" (as with a car) would be an appropriate word for the offence @NZMorningReport
Re "stealing water"; it's part of the defn of theft (Crimes Act) that you intend to deprive the owner permanently. That's hard to do w water
"Mexgutter": Possibly a derogatory term for Mexico. Just heard on @NZMorningReport: "He's gunna get Mexgutter pay for the wall."
@robmanuel @conorsmith Also a concert-hall doorman wearing his in his top jacket pocket.
@robmanuel @conorsmith I've seen a waiter wearing a bow tie round his wrist. I guess regulations said he had to wear one, but not where.
@ChrisBellNZ @paulbrislen @nzdodo Then of course there are health & environmental "experts" ready to say you can't use certain ingredients.
@paulbrislen @ChrisBellNZ @nzdodo ...by navigating an n+1-dimensional "surface". Very clever stuff.
@paulbrislen @ChrisBellNZ @nzdodo To save money. What other reason is there? They plot current cost of each ingredient & calculate minima...
Can anyone honestly think of anything that _isn't_ "easier said than done"? #schoolholidays @CheckpointRNZ
I'm glad he cleared that up. @radionz
"We're talking to the professor who's running a course on evil" @radionz Nights. "Good evening How are you?" "I'm good".
@ArrantPedantry @EditorMark @MerriamWebster Hello preferred. Hullo marked as a British variant.
@MerriamWebster a cloque is a secret group. And a cluque is a group too "chicken" to disagree publicly with the majority.
.@WhiteHouse press secretary promises to keep session going for as long as reporters have questions. Invitation to #filibuster?
There's still an interesting textural scarring effect and I wonder if that will be permanent.
What it's doing to my spinal posture is another matter :) But pain & redness less every day. Yay for #antibiotics #Sardinian #sewer #fungus
I think I've got the hang of this now. Set the chair sideways; put right leg on it first; then put the left up on t… https://t.co/hbN2W1GWbW
Wonder how the top execs of US movie & music industries are reacting to @realDonaldTrump's plans to can #TPPA.
"...and a flounder that we're going to talk through." @ninetonoon #chinesenewyear #recipes #ventriloquism
I suspected I wasn't the first to think of this https://t.co/UrhXN3JTgN Is he One of Them? Or 1 of their sworn enemies?
@pikelet And coinkydinkally, this turns up next to yours in my Twitter-stream https://t.co/HQ5ic78d2R
TIL: the antibiotic I'm taking for #cellulitis was extracted from a fungus found in a Sardinian sewer. Maybe that explains the aftertaste.
@Yamiche @xeni Odd place to start the quote: https://t.co/yG92C8GqCj
@ThelemicWaves Ah, Tony the Tiger: mascot of empty calories :)
@AdamModiano @shelbyfero I'm increasingly thinking Papal elections have the right idea. You keep on till one candidate gets 2/3 of the vote
@realscientists Almost: They are accustomed to a closed set of curves being used to indicate a solid object's boundaries. #notobvious
Insert your own missing word in the sentence: "Trump will make America _______ again".
@ananavarro @independent @cnn A lot of yaktivists will be longing for the yaks to fall :) #Tussaud #revolution #guillotine
@Fritinancy ...& moved to another town. But she did not pound the road with her fists or fall on it. Is that "literally" or "figuratively"?
@Fritinancy Some1 said y'day "I literally hit the road". Rather than just distancing socially from the situation, she actually walked out...
Position 17 is where the dotted line is, apparently #cantseethelogic #keeplosingcount https://t.co/tpEpFVbCHq
Stuff I'm putting on my skin contains "hydrocortisone-17-butyrate".I've never had to count positions on an organic molecule higher than 5.
Michael Venus, Freddie Mercury, Bruno Mars...Do we have any Jupiters or Saturns? Uranuses?
@stevebwriter _where_ they're not needed.
It's discouraging to think of these antibiotics & "painkillers" swilling around the many parts of my body there they're _not_ needed #focus
@Jay_Jeffs @NewspaperDickz ...which is a facility I've sworn never to use, because I think it's insecure. Must make "tinfoil hat" for card
@Jay_Jeffs @NewspaperDickz I go to slide, then remember & twiddle card round aiming to use chip. Machine beeps. I've paid by PINless NFC...
@Fritinancy @TheSlot Verifying "scran", I find "scran spanners" (cutlery). Must find an opportunity to use it. Eating-irons, gobbling-rods.
@Fritinancy @TheSlot You might have your bevvy at smoko. There might be a bevy of you having bevvies.
@Fritinancy @TheSlot If you're lucky, you'll get a bite of scran (solid food) with your bevvy. Northern English originally, I think.
When I read "sentenced after drunken dash" I think streaking - not getting in your car to fetch Maccas. More dangerous, but less good story.
So that last remark was uncalled for. One reviewer said the same about the sequel to "All Quiet on the Western Front."
"We have had another look at your #NCEA exam as requested, & you still failed," he remarked.
If the date ramp led into the warp-lane, it could be the story of a strange & combative relationship.
"Joe & Susan had been good friends for years, but were now definitely on a date-ramp". Or maybe it's just a device in a dried-fruit factory.
Does anyone else's mind shift the terminal letters of 2-word phrases? So day-tramp becomes date-ramp & war-plane warp lane...
I think there should be a general rule that if the result of any political ballot is closer than 52/48, you do it again. #Trump #brexit
I have, of course been told to stop taking the first medication.
Is there any real meaning (code) to the colour of medicinal capsules? Eg green = anti-inflammatory. Or is it just branding?
@Glinner @GreatDismal The word is Dada. The US is beginning a Dada presidency.
Original medication doesn't seem to be working. Switched to new stuff. Immediate improvement, but is it the new, or the old finally working?
Cake
Headline of the day? "Bat out of Hell". Wicketkeeper hit by bat slipping from batsman's grasp. @NZStuff
Silly ad slogans: "We do doing" - Warehouse Stationery. Well they do sell rubber bands :)
An encounter marked by crankiness, doubts that 1 or other wd turn up, & some WTF?! moves it was thought might be ingenious but were stupid.
Trump & Putin rumoured planning summit in Reykjavik. Remember when Top USian & Russian met there 45 years ago https://t.co/jWDf1M2yDJ
"Five months free from fleas' antics" #circus? It is an animal they're talking about, right?
Big Data collection & "targeted marketing" is so, so phisticated FB is pitching me months' freedom from fleas & ticks. I don't own an animal
@mpesce @alexandraerin looking at human bodies in the same light right now.
@vaughndavis sedan chair?
Coming up, w'll reminisce on the life of Lord Snowdon. Meanwhile here's 60s girl-group the Crystals Don't you love how relevant @radionz is?
Walking (and getting up from soft chairs) more easily. Less pain; but my legs still look like they belong to 2 different people #cellulitis
The wedding anniversary (& birthstone, etc) thing is about gifts, so I suppose commerce drives it. But silver, gold, ruby is about my limit.
Why any school syllabus ever should have thought "gaggle of geese, parliament of owls" important to remember is beyond me. But mine did.
If I had to choose 2 topics to lose in order to clear space in my brain it'd be names for wedding anniversaries & animal collective nouns :)
Thought I was going to get another perfect score on @NZStuff #quiz. Then a footballer came up...and a qustion about wedding anniversaries...
@emckean So technically, I reckon they were open #performativeutterance. But still closed.
@emckean The version of that I remember was "sorry, we're closed today; we're having an opening ceremony" CEO had done the "opening" by then
In answer to the breakfast host at @radionz (@NZMorningReport's holiday version) the 1st word ever uttered was probably "Hey! or "Look out!"
So you think up pain numbers in advance for Dr - "it's a 2 normally, but goes to a 6 or 7 if I put weight on the leg" - & he never asks.
@vaughndavis @Fonterra Best not to ask how much someone got paid for coming up with that astounding slogan. "Don't just say cheese - do it!"
@vaughndavis @Fonterra Cheese! OK: Now what?
@BR3NDA The other guests are called what: chicks? #notuponthis
